newsitem.title: USA: Comshare sees $6 mln restructuring charge.
newsitem.headline: Comshare sees $6 mln restructuring charge.

text.p: Comshare Inc said Wednesday it would take an estimated $6 million pre-tax restructuring charge in its third quarter ending March 31.
A preliminary decision, subject to a legally required notice period, has been made to consolidate all product development activities in Ann Arbor, Mich., the software company said.
"In addition, we are taking other cost-reduction actions, including reductions in management and non-revenue-generating costs," Chief Executive T. Wallace Wrathall said in a news release.
The company did not say how many jobs would be cut.
Total annual cost savings from the moves is about $7 million, Comshare said.

Comshare today reported a loss of $2.8 million, or $0.28 a share, for the second quarter ended December 31, compared with a loss of $12.9 million, or $1.48 per share, a year earlier, which included a $15.5 million after-tax writedown of capitalized software.
